Participants.evidence: This study evaluated regional lung volume displacement in nine healthy volunteers (6 males, 3 females; ages 29 – 55 years; BMI 20.2 – 31.3 kg/m 2 )

Intervention.evidence: Participants were assessed during tidal breathing and, also with 15 cm H 2 O inspiratory and 5 cm H 2 O expiratory pressures in a supine position.

Objective.evidence: We aimed to examine a non-contrast imaging method of spatial lung volume displacement, adapted to assess changes with non-invasive positive pressure ventilation (NIPPV)

Method_Outcome.evidence: Regional specific ventilation (SV) was measured during tidal breathing and NIPPV.

Result_Outcome.evidence: NIPPV increased MSV in both peripheral (p=0.01) and central (p=0.02) lung regions compared to tidal breathing.
